New Records: Iceland secured a comeback draw with Wales after trailing 0-2 at halftime.
Logi Tomasson scored twice for Iceland, including an equalizer in the 73rd minute and another goal in the 69th minute.
Wales scored twice in the first half through Harry Wilson and Brennan Johnson.
Key Match Events: Wales led 2-0 at halftime after goals by Harry Wilson and Brennan Johnson.
Iceland turned the game around with two goals by Logi Tomasson in the second half.
Brennan Johnson was booked and missed the next match due to a yellow card.
The match was held in cold conditions in Reykjavik.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales had a strong historical record against Iceland, with four consecutive wins before the match.
Iceland had a poor record against Wales, with only one win in seven meetings since 1984.
Craig Bellamy, Wales' manager, was noted for his aggressive style and strong performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy praised his team's resilience after the comeback draw.
Wales' point was significant as they fought back from a two-goal deficit.
Iceland's ability to recover and equalize was highlighted by their manager.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was followed by a live blog and updates throughout the game.
Notable players included Harry Wilson and Brennan Johnson for Wales, and Logi Tomasson for Iceland.
Others: The game was part of the Nations League tournament.
